sentence.Network_en: These are people who should be in the prime of their wage - earning years.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些人本应处于工资收入的黄金时期.

sentence.Network_en: Charlie was earning eight pounds, I was earning five.
sentence.Network_cn: 查利赚了8英镑，我赚了5英镑。

sentence.Network_en: He was a high-earning broker with money to burn.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是高收入的经纪人，有花不完的钱。

list.abs: an often unrealized fact about capitalism is this : savings mean benefits for all those who are anxious to produce or to earn wages .关于资本主义人们经常没有认识到的一个事实是：储蓄符合所有那些希望生产或者希望挣工资的人的利益。
wage - earning population ., 受薪人口.
'retain... ... Earnings of public institutions 创收 wage earnings 工资收入 accumulated earnings 累积收益.
wages earned or paid during the base period of an unemployment insurance claim .在失业保险索赔的基本周期内支付或所得的工资。

means.word_mean: 1. working for hourly wages rather than fixed (e.g. annual) salaries;

sentences.sentence: "working-class occupations include manual as well as industrial labor"

means.word_mean: 2. of those who work for wages especially manual or industrial laborers;

auth_sentence.content: Maybe he really is earning that title after all.
auth_sentence.res_content: Maybe he really is earning that title after all.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Maybe he really is earning that title after all.

auth_sentence.content: They thought maybe we weren't earning enough money.
auth_sentence.res_content: They thought maybe we weren't earning enough money.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They thought maybe we weren't earning enough money.

auth_sentence.content: We don't need to change the minimum wage.
auth_sentence.res_content: We don't need to change the minimum wage.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We don't need to change the minimum wage.
